dmca.title: Complainant Asks for Photo of Self to be Removed from Google
dmca.body:
Hello there.

For the third time now I find that Google has somehow re-indexed the
http://www.warwick.ac.uk/gifted/summer-school/2002/images/khyle-westmoreland
.gif [space in original] picture. I have already asked twice previously for this picture to be removed, and has [sic] been successful but it keeps returning to the search results. The strange thing is, the picture has not existed on the server for months, after asking the webmaster to remove it.

Could you please remove it from the search results again, and preferably stop the Image search from ever indexing it again?

For formalities:

1.
http://www.warwick.ac.uk/gifted/summer-school/2002/images/khyle-westmoreland.gif, no.

2. [private]@[private].org.uk

3. [private]@warwick.ac.uk

4. I swear, under penalty of perjury, that the information in the
notification is accurate and that, for each image identified above, I either
own the copyright or am authorized to act on behalf of the owner of an
exclusive right that is allegedly infringed.

Thank you very much for your time and I hope this problem can be resolved
easily.

[private]
http://www.khyle.org.uk/
